title: John Batchelor-china-punishes-mickey-mouse-Apple.mp3
description:
China Punishes Mickey Mouse & Steve Jobs. Scarborough Showdown. @gordongchang. Fraser Howie. @harrykazianis.

John Batchelor April 27,2016 mp3

A spokesperson for Alibaba said the service was "undergoing maintenance" and that customers were being refunded. The Wall Street Journal, citing two unidentified sources, reported that DisneyLife had been "suspended at the request of Chinese regulators."

If confirmed, the suspension would mark the latest move in a broader crackdown on digital media. Apple's (AAPL, Tech30) iBooks and iTunes Movies services were shut down in China last week.

â€œA Disney representative declined to comment, saying the company only licenses the content to Alibaba.

Disney (DIS) entered a partnership with Alibaba (BABA, Tech30) in December. The DisneyLife service allows Chinese customers to stream Disney films, play games and read digital books via a Mickey Mouse-shaped decoder.

Related: China's latest move to strengthen its grip on the Internet

â€œDisney is trying to expand in China, betting big on the country's growing middle class. Mainland China's first Disney theme park is set to open in June, after a decade of planning and investment of $5.5 billion.

â€œMonitoring digital content is a top priority for Beijing, which has invested heavily in a massive censorship apparatus dubbed the "Great Firewall." Thousands of websites including(FB, Tech30), Google (GOOG) and Twitter (TWTR, Tech30) are blocked, and even domestic social media platforms are heavily censored.
 
http://money.cnn.com/2016/04/26/media/disneylife-alibaba-china/
 
http://www.breitbart.com/tech/2016/04/24/china-punishes-apple-shutting-itunes-movies/

The John Batchelor Show
